@description.name: @description

@deprecated.name: @deprecated
@deprecated.body: {6.0} You should use Array.filter method to filter the table model

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Function to get the full array of the filtered model

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} the full array of model (with no changes)
@return.description: the full array of model (with no changes)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the given string (needle) is in the array (haystack)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: the_needle {String} String to search
@param.description: String to search

@param.name: @param
@param.body: the_haystack {Array} Array, which should be searched
@param.description: Array, which should be searched

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} whether the search string was found.
@return.description: whether the search string was found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The addBetweenFilter method is used to add a between filter to the
table model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
filter {String}
The type of filter. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".
@param.description: The type of filter. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
The first value to compare against.
@param.description: The first value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value2 {Integer}
The second value to compare against.
@param.description: The second value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If the filter can not recognized or one of the values
is null.
@throws.description:
If the filter can not recognized or one of the values
is null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The addNumericFilter method is used to add a basic numeric filter to
the table model.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The type of filter. Accepted strings are:
"==", "!=", ">", "<", ">=", and "<=".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
The value to compare against.
@param.description: The value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the filter can not recognized or the target is null.
@throws.description: If the filter can not recognized or the target is null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The addRegex method is used to add a regular expression filter to the
table model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regex {String}
The regular expression to match against.
@param.description: The regular expression to match against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
ignorecase {Boolean}
If true, the regular expression will ignore case.
@param.description: If true, the regular expression will ignore case.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the regex is not valid.
@throws.description: If the regex is not valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The addNotRegex method is used to add a regular expression filter to the
table model and filter cells that do not match.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regex {String}
The regular expression to match against.
@param.description: The regular expression to match against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {String}
The text value of the column to compare against.
@param.description: The text value of the column to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
ignorecase {Boolean}
If true, the regular expression will ignore case.
@param.description: If true, the regular expression will ignore case.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The applyFilters method is called to apply filters to the table model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hides a specified number of rows.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowNum {Integer}
Index of the first row to be hidden in the table.
@param.description: Index of the first row to be hidden in the table.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
numOfRows {Integer}
The number of rows to be hidden sequentially after rowNum.
@param.description: The number of rows to be hidden sequentially after rowNum.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
dispatchEvent {Boolean?true} Whether a model change event should
be fired.
@param.description:
Whether a model change event should
be fired.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Return the table to the original state with all rows shown and clears
all filters.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowArr {var[][]} An array containing an array for each row. Each
row-array contains the values in that row in the order of the columns
in this model.
@param.description:
An array containing an array for each row. Each
row-array contains the values in that row in the order of the columns
in this model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clearSorting {Boolean ? true} Whether to clear the sort state.
@param.description: Whether to clear the sort state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property caseSensitiveSorting. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #caseSensitiveSorting}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property caseSensitiveSorting. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #caseSensitiveSorting}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property caseSensitiveSorting. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #caseSensitiveSorting}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property caseSensitiveSorting. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #caseSensitiveSorting}.
